channel.title: Compiler- Unanswered Question/Error
channel.description:
I was searching through everywhere you can think of, I searched the first 9 pages of google, and any sites that were connected to the sites I had checked. No one has the answer to a pretty common problem. I'm running Windows 7, and using jdk1.6.0_23, I was using 1.7 but I thought the newer version was corrupted or something. I have my compiler AND all my .java's located in C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin I have Path and CLASSPATH set to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin; my compiler code is [code]javac *.java pause[/code]
my error is
[code]C:\Windows\system32>javac *.java javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
C:\Windows\systerm32>pause Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I assure you, my Environmental Variables are correct, and my .java files are in the same directory specified, and the same as the compiler. I am not new to java and this error makes no sense. It is implying that there's no java files there when there clearly are.
Sorry if this is in the wrong section, or not under the right Topic etc. I highly doubt I'll get a solution anyhow. But feel free to tell me that it's not, or give a solution to try. ---------------------------
[b]Problem Solved [/b] ~ by me. Sorry for wasting time :)

item.title: Compiler- Unanswered Question/Error
item.dc:creator: @kbdraco kbdraco
item.description:
@kbdraco wrote:

I was searching through everywhere you can think of, I searched the first 9 pages of google, and any sites that were connected to the sites I had checked. No one has the answer to a pretty common problem.
I’m running Windows 7, and using jdk1.6.0_23, I was using 1.7 but I thought the newer version was corrupted or something.
I have my compiler AND all my .java’s located in C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin
I have Path and CLASSPATH set to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin;
my compiler code is

javac *.java pause

my error is

[code]C:\Windows\system32>javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options

C:\Windows\systerm32>pause
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

I assure you, my Environmental Variables are correct, and my .java files are in the same directory specified, and the same as the compiler. I am not new to java and this error makes no sense. It is implying that there’s no java files there when there clearly are.

Sorry if this is in the wrong section, or not under the right Topic etc. I highly doubt I’ll get a solution anyhow. But feel free to tell me that it’s not, or give a solution to try.

Problem Solved ~ by me. Sorry for wasting time
